parameters.content:
# AI-Powered Market Intelligence Bot

## Overview
This n8n workflow automatically monitors TechCrunch for AI-related articles, using Firecrawl's AI-powered web scraping to extract clean, structured data and OpenAI to generate actionable summaries delivered directly to your team's Slack channel.

## üöÄ 1. Trigger & Scheduling

### Daily Method Research Trigger
- Initiates automated TechCrunch monitoring on a scheduled basis
- Default: Daily execution to capture fresh AI industry news and trends
- Configurable for different frequencies based on market velocity
- Ensures consistent intelligence gathering without manual intervention

## üîç 2. Web Scraping & Data Collection

### Firecrawl Integration (HTTP Request Node)
- Targets TechCrunch specifically: `https://techcrunch.com` (though, can obviously be changed)
- Crawls a specificed amount of articles with `"limit" -- by default this is set to 20, otherwise it would keep scraping. You can remove this limit to scrape all. 
- Focuses on current year content with `"includePaths": ["2025/"]` In 2026, you'll need to update this.
- Extracts markdown format for clean, structured content
- Uses `"onlyMainContent": true` to avoid ads and navigation clutter
- Built-in anti-bot detection bypass and automatic JavaScript rendering

### Code Text/Concat Processing
- Filters scraped TechCrunch articles for AI relevance
- AI research assistant determines if articles relate to artificial intelligence, machine learning, AI companies, or AI technology
- Automatically excludes non-AI content with "NOT_AI_RELATED" filtering
- Processes article titles, descriptions, and full content for comprehensive analysis

## ‚è±Ô∏è 3. Processing Flow Control

### Wait Node
- Implements controlled delays to respect TechCrunch's server resources
- Enough time to receive results back

## üîß Configuration & Customization

### TechCrunch Scraping Setup
- Configured to crawl `https://techcrunch.com` with 20 article limit
- Focuses on current year content with date path filtering
- Markdown extraction for clean, readable content processing
- 4-hour cache setting (`"maxAge": 14400000`) for efficiency

### AI Relevance Detection
- Built-in AI research assistant determines article relevance
- Filters specifically for artificial intelligence, machine learning, AI companies, and AI technology
- Binary classification: AI-related articles get summarized, others get filtered out
- Reduces noise by focusing only on AI industry developments

### Slack Integration
- TechCrunch-specific formatting with source attribution
- AI-focused message structure with bullet point summaries
- Integration with Slack threads for AI trend discussions
- Notification preferences for AI industry updates

## üí° Best Practices

1. **Monitor TechCrunch Coverage**: Track how much AI content TechCrunch publishes daily
2. **AI Relevance Accuracy**: Review filtered articles to ensure important AI stories aren't missed
3. **Summary Quality**: Periodically check that 3-bullet summaries capture key AI insights
4. **Team Engagement**: Use Slack reactions to identify most valuable AI trends
5. **Source Verification**: Always include TechCrunch links for fact-checking and deeper reading

## üîÑ Maintenance & Monitoring

- **TechCrunch Access**: Monitor Firecrawl success rates for TechCrunch crawling
- **AI Classification**: Track accuracy of AI relevance detection
- **Content Freshness**: Ensure date filtering captures latest AI articles
- **Delivery Success**: Confirm AI summaries reach Slack channels consistently
- **Cost Management**: Monitor OpenAI usage for TechCrunch article processing

## üéØ Business Impact

This workflow transforms AI market intelligence from manual TechCrunch reading into an automated pipeline that delivers:

- **Daily AI-focused insights** from TechCrunch without manual browsing
- **Filtered relevance** ensuring only AI industry news reaches your team
- **Structured summaries** optimized for quick consumption of AI trends
- **Team awareness** of AI developments through integrated Slack discussions
- **Source credibility** with direct links to TechCrunch articles

Perfect for AI product teams, tech investors, and executives who need to stay current on artificial intelligence developments without spending time manually browsing TechCrunch.

## ü§ñ 4. AI-Powered Analysis & Summarization

### OpenAI Summarizer (AI Agent)
- Uses GPT-4o-mini for cost-effective, high-quality analysis
- AI research assistant prompt determines AI relevance before summarizing
- For AI-related articles: generates 3 bullet point summaries
- For non-AI articles: responds with "NOT_AI_RELATED" to filter out
- Processes TechCrunch article title, description, and full content
- Maintains source attribution with original TechCrunch URLs

### Split Output Processing
- Distributes processed TechCrunch articles across parallel analysis streams
- Enables simultaneous processing of multiple articles
- Optimizes workflow performance for large news batches
- Maintains data integrity during multi-path processing

## üìä 5. Intelligence Filtering & Quality Control

### Filter Messages Node
- Removes articles marked as "NOT_AI_RELATED" by the AI assistant
- Applies relevance scoring to prevent information overload
- Ensures only AI-focused TechCrunch content reaches stakeholders
- Customizable filtering logic based on AI relevance confidence

## üì§ 6. Delivery & Distribution

### Send Summary to Slack
- Delivers formatted AI intelligence from TechCrunch to specified channels
- Message format includes: Article title + 3 bullet point summary + TechCrunch source link
- Supports threaded conversations for team discussions about AI trends
- Click-through links to original TechCrunch articles for deeper research
- Rich formatting optimized for mobile and desktop consumptio
